block.p: Kara Visconti and Frank Blanco were married yesterday at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan. The Rev. George M. Witt, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.
The couple met at Boston College, from which they graduated, he summa cum laude.
Kara Visconti and Frank Blanco were married yesterday at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan. The Rev. George M. Witt, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.
Kara Visconti and Frank Blanco were married yesterday at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in Manhattan. The Rev. George M. Witt, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.
The couple met at Boston College, from which they graduated, he summa cum laude.
The bride, 31, is a merchandiser for Macy's in Manhattan, where she provides strategic buying direction for men's dress shirts and neckwear.
She is the daughter of Kathy and Richard Visconti of Roslyn, N.Y. Her father works in Hicksville, N.Y., as the assistant general counsel of KeySpan Energy, the Brooklyn-based gas utility company.

The bridegroom, also 31, is a vice president at Keefe, Bruyette & Woods, a Manhattan-based investment bank, where he specializes in advising corporations on mergers and acquisitions and raising capital.

He is the son of Wendy and Frank Blanco Jr. of Overland Park, Kan. His mother is a teacher's aide there who assists special-needs children at Indian Valley Elementary School. His father is the vice president for distributor sales with Nazdar, a manufacturer of printing inks and chemicals in Shawnee, Kan.
